examples: The sunflower turned its face towards the sun.
The victory turned the tide of the war in North Africa.
The thunder had turned the milk.
Police turned water cannon on the rioters.
Turn the mould upside down.
words.defineEn: to change the position of our body or part of our body in a way that we face a different direction
words.defineVi: để thay đổi vị trí của cơ thể hoặc một phần cơ thể của chúng ta theo cách mà chúng ta phải đối mặt với một hướng khác

examples: listen to our problems.
Listen Jane.
I listened carefully to her story.
Don’t listen to Jerry.
Don't listen to him.
words.defineEn: to give our attention to the sound a person or thing is making
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho sự chú ý của chúng tôi đến âm thanh một người hoặc điều đang làm

examples: He's hoping for an offer of compensation.
I hope this guilty verdict puts that rat of a CEO in his place.
I hope you have it on your conscience for the rest of your days!
I hope this letter reaches you.
I hope you've learned a lesson from this, Eddie.
words.defineEn: to want something to happen or be true
words.defineVi: để muốn một cái gì đó xảy ra hoặc là sự thật

examples: The old customs are dying.
All men must die.
The flowers died during a dry spell.
My father died suddenly at the age of 48.
The die is cast.
words.defineEn: to no longer be alive
words.defineVi: không còn sống

examples: That song always sends a shiver down my spine.
Anne's aunt always sends her birthday cards and gifts.
I sent the package by airmail.
He sent me a copy of his new book.
She sent the kids to bed early.
words.defineEn: to take something to a specific location or making arrangements for it to be taken there, particularly by post
words.defineVi: để đưa một cái gì đó đến một địa điểm cụ thể hoặc sắp xếp để nó được đưa đến đó, đặc biệt là qua đường bưu điện

examples: The tax increase sounded the death knell for the business.
He sounds about as much fun as a wet weekend in Carmarthenshire.
The bell sounded for dinner.
A cup of tea sounds perfect.
Your presentation sounded great, honestly.
words.defineEn: to convey or make a specific impression when read about or when heard
words.defineVi: để truyền đạt hoặc tạo ấn tượng cụ thể khi đọc về hoặc khi nghe

examples: His face wore a puzzled look.
Both men wore confident smiles.
My mom wears facial mask sometmes.
The police officer wears a uniform and a badge.
He wears glasses now.
words.defineEn: to have something such as clothes, shoes, etc. on your body
words.defineVi: để có một cái gì đó như quần áo, giày dép, vv trên cơ thể của bạn

examples: Both drivers shared the blame for the accident.
My friend shared a bag of chocolate-covered macadamia nuts with us.
The locals generously shared their knowledge of manioc processing techniques.
All members of the band equally share the band's profits.
The HR department only shared the employee's personal information on a need-to-know basis.
words.defineEn: to have or use something with someone else at the same time
words.defineVi: để có hoặc sử dụng một cái gì đó với người khác cùng một lúc

examples: His incorrect translation of the phrase caused a misunderstanding between the two parties.
Are you causing trouble again?
The organization supports various charitable causes through donations.
The long delay at the airport caused her great vexation as she was running late for an important meeting.
The power outage caused the traffic lights to go haywire.
words.defineEn: to make someone do something or to make something happen, usually something bad
words.defineVi: để làm cho ai đó làm một cái gì đó hoặc để làm cho một cái gì đó xảy ra, thường là một cái gì đó xấu

examples: The squash player killed the ball with a nick.
The sauce would kill the taste of the herbs.
Too much garlic killed the taste of the meat.
Cancer kills thousands of people every year.
The outstanding finale killed the audience.
words.defineEn: to end the life of someone or something
words.defineVi: để kết thúc cuộc sống của một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: A true leader walks the talk.
The old lady walked slowly with the support of her cane.
The father proudly walked his daughter down the aisle on her wedding day.
They walk their dogs every day.
She walked the horse around the ring.
words.defineEn: to move forward at a regular speed by placing our feet in front of each other one by one
words.defineVi: di chuyển về phía trước với tốc độ đều đặn bằng cách đặt chân của chúng ta trước mặt nhau từng cái một

examples: The committee meets once a fortnight.
The car met the bus head-on.
He met his death in 1946.
I meet my study group at the library on Tuesday afternoons.
We usually meet at the coffee shop on Fridays.
words.defineEn: to come together in a place with others to do something special
words.defineVi: đến với nhau ở một nơi với những người khác để làm điều gì đó đặc biệt

examples: She guessed the answer straight away.
"Your guess is as good as mine."
Surely she would guess the truth.
He had already guessed the answer.
Far from eye, far from heart, I guess.
words.defineEn: to estimate or form a conclusion about something without sufficient information to verify its accuracy
words.defineVi: để ước tính hoặc hình thành một kết luận về một cái gì đó mà không có đủ thông tin để xác minh tính chính xác của nó

examples: That DJ's voice really sets my teeth on edge.
The surgeon set her broken arm.
The scheme sets a precedent for other companies.
International companies set the price of oil.
His time in the 25-meter freestyle set a national record.
words.defineEn: to prepare something in a way that is ready or suitable for use
words.defineVi: để chuẩn bị một cái gì đó trong một cách đã sẵn sàng hoặc phù hợp để sử dụng

examples: A mixture of skill and good luck decided the outcome of the game.
The courts decided in favor of the New York claimants.
The Appeal Court decided in their favour.
The case will be decided by a jury.
The government decided to abandon the proposed legislation due to public opposition.
words.defineEn: to think carefully about different things and choose one of them
words.defineVi: suy nghĩ cẩn thận về những điều khác nhau và chọn một trong số họ

examples: The struggle ended indecisively.
The surfaced road ends at the farm.
Grab the end of the rope.’
The play has too many loose ends.
All good things come to an end.
words.defineEn: to stop or finish something
words.defineVi: để dừng lại hoặc kết thúc một cái gì đó

examples: She chose a knee-length skirt for the office.
May I choose the restaurant?
He chose a seat facing the door.
Many people choose not to marry.
He chose to go.
words.defineEn: to decide what we want to have or what is best for us from a group of options
words.defineVi: để quyết định những gì chúng tôi muốn có hoặc những gì là tốt nhất cho chúng tôi từ một nhóm các tùy chọn

examples: Just click the link below.
The cameras clicked away.
The bolt clicked into place.
They clicked straight away.
It all clicked into place.
words.defineEn: to select an item or function from a computer screen, etc. using a mouse or touchpad
words.defineVi: để chọn một mục hoặc chức năng từ màn hình máy tính, v.v. bằng chuột hoặc bàn di chuột

examples: Three cheers for Sarah, whose brilliant goal at the last minute won us the game!
The fast runner won the race by a wide margin.
Which team won?
The proposal has won the approval of the city council.
Our team actually won!
words.defineEn: to become the most successful, the luckiest, or the best in a game, race, fight, etc.
words.defineVi: để trở thành người thành công nhất, may mắn nhất hoặc giỏi nhất trong một trò chơi, cuộc đua, cuộc chiến, v.v.

examples: The goalie saved Johnson's long-range shot.
Save data frequently.
But a truck driver saved her bacon.
Save your breath, Tom.
To save a penalty.
words.defineEn: to keep someone or something safe and away from harm, death, etc.
words.defineVi: để giữ cho ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó an toàn và tránh xa tổn hại, cái chết, vv

examples: The old man considered his granddaughter thoughtfully.
The committee has been considering the report.
The renowned scientist, Dr. Rebecca Thompson, is considered the big enchilada in the field of quantum physics.
Have you considered my feelings?
Have you considered my feelings?
words.defineEn: to think carefully about a possibility or before making a decision
words.defineVi: suy nghĩ cẩn thận về một khả năng hoặc trước khi đưa ra quyết định

examples: Their last album sold millions.
Her last book sold millions of copies.
I recently sold my bike.
The tickets are selling like hot cakes
Do not your lawyers sell all their practice, as your priests their prayers?
words.defineEn: to give something to someone in exchange for money
words.defineVi: để đưa một cái gì đó cho một ai đó để đổi lấy tiền

examples: Their approach to sports teaching broke the mold.
The movie broke all box-office records.
The movie broke box office records in the US.
The bag broke under the weight of the bottles inside it.
My watch has broken.
words.defineEn: to become damaged and separated into pieces because of a blow, shock, etc.
words.defineVi: trở nên hư hỏng và tách thành từng mảnh do va đập, sốc, v.v.

examples: Troops drove out the demonstrators.
Hunger drives the wolf out of the wood.
A stream of black cars drove by.
A stream of black cars drove by.
The waves drove against the shore.
words.defineEn: to control the movement and the speed of a car, bus, truck, etc. when it is moving
words.defineVi: để kiểm soát chuyển động và tốc độ của ô tô, xe buýt, xe tải, v.v. khi nó đang di chuyển

examples: Check the remix.
The active ingredient checks the growth of bacteria.
Check the box next to the right answer.
I’ll check the dates.
Any baggage over five kilos must be checked.
words.defineEn: to make sure that a thing is true, correct, present, or in a good condition by examining something
words.defineVi: để đảm bảo rằng một điều là đúng, chính xác, hiện tại hoặc trong tình trạng tốt bằng cách kiểm tra một cái gì đó
